All conditioned things are impermanent, they are subject to destruction;

The ocean of the wisdom of the Buddha is also like this. It flows into the minds of all sentient beings. If sentient beings contemplate the realm of objects and cultivate the Dharma door, they will attain the clear and pure wisdom. The wisdom of the TathÄgata is equal and non-dual, without discrimination. It only follows the differences in the mental activities of sentient beings, so the wisdom they attain is each different.
Buddha's disciple!
This is the third characteristic of the mind of the TathÄgata, which all Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should know in this way.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!
It is like the great ocean, which has four precious jewels, endowed with immeasurable virtues, able to produce all the precious treasures within the ocean;
If there were no such jewel in the great ocean, not even a single jewel could be obtained.
What are the four?
The first is called
Accumulated Treasures, the second is called
The Inexhaustible Treasury, the third is called
Free from Burning, and the fourth is called
Complete Adornment.
Buddha's disciples!
These four precious jewels are not seen by any ordinary beings, dragons, or spirits.
Why is it so?
Because the precious jewels of the Naga King Sagara are placed in the deep and secret chambers of his palace.
Buddha's disciples!

The great ocean of wisdom of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is also like this. Within it, there are four great wisdom jewels, replete with immeasurable blessings, wisdom, and merits. Because of this, it can give rise to the wisdom jewels of all beings, Shravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, those in training and no longer in training, and Bodhisattvas.
What are the four?
They are:

The great wisdom treasure of skillful means free from defilement and attachment, the great wisdom treasure of well discerning conditioned and unconditioned dharmas, the great wisdom treasure of expounding immeasurable dharmas without destroying the nature of dharmas, and the great wisdom treasure of knowing the proper and improper times without ever making a mistake.
If these four treasures were not in the great wisdom ocean of the TathÄgatas, it would be impossible for a single sentient being to enter the MahÄyÄna.
These four wisdom treasures cannot be seen by those of little merit.
Why is it so?
Because they are placed in the TathÄgata's profound treasury.
These four wisdom treasures are balanced, upright, pure, and wondrous, universally able to benefit the assembly of bodhisattvas, enabling them all to attain the light of wisdom.
Buddha's disciple!
This is the fourth characteristic of the TathÄgata's mind, which all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should know in this way.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!

It is like the great ocean, in which there are four blazing, luminous, great treasures laid out on the bottom, whose nature is extremely fierce and hot, and which are always able to drink up and shrink the immeasurable great waters poured into it by the hundreds of rivers, for this reason the great ocean has no increase or decrease.
What are the four?
The first is called:
Sun Treasury, the second is called:
Separating Moisture, the third is called:
Blazing Flames Light, the fourth is called:
Exhausting Without Remainder.
Buddha's disciple!
If there were no these four treasures in the great ocean, everything from the four continents up to the summit of existence would be flooded and destroyed.
Buddha's disciple!

When the light of this great treasure Sun Treasury shines on it, the seawater is completely transformed into milk;ğŸ”½when the light of the great treasure Separating Moisture shines on it, the milk is completely transformed into curds;ğŸ”½when the light of the great treasure Blazing Flames Light shines on it, the curds are completely transformed into butter;
when the light of the great treasure Exhausting Without Remainder shines on it, the butter is transformed into ghee;
Like a blazing fire, they are all consumed without remainder.
Buddha's disciple!
The great wisdom ocean of the Tathagata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is also like this. There are four kinds of great wisdom jewels, replete with immeasurable majestic light;
The light of these wisdom jewels touches all bodhisattvas, enabling them to attain the great wisdom of the Tathagata.
What are the four?
They are:

The great wisdom jewel that extinguishes all the waves of scattered wholesome activities, the great wisdom jewel that eliminates all craving for dharmas, the great wisdom jewel that illuminates everywhere with the light of wisdom, and the great wisdom jewel that grants the boundless effortless equality with the Tathagata.
Buddha's disciple!

When bodhisattvas cultivate all the dharmas that assist the Way, they give rise to immeasurable waves of scattered wholesome activities, which cannot be destroyed by any worldly gods, humans, or asuras;

The TathÄgata uses the light of the great wisdom treasure of extinguishing all scattered wholesome waves to touch those bodhisattvas, causing them to abandon all scattered wholesome waves, to hold the mind in a single realm, and to abide in samÄdhi;

He also uses the light of the great wisdom treasure of removing all craving for dharmas to touch those bodhisattvas, causing them to abandon attachment to the taste of samÄdhi and to give rise to vast spiritual powers;

He also uses the light of the great wisdom treasure of universally illuminating with wisdom to touch those bodhisattvas, causing them to abandon the vast spiritual powers they have given rise to and to abide in the practice of great illumination and effort;

He also uses the light of the great wisdom treasure of bestowing the boundless effortless equality with the TathÄgatas to touch those bodhisattvas, causing them to abandon the practice of great illumination and effort, and so on, up to attaining the level of equality with the TathÄgatas, ceasing all effort without remainder.
Buddha's disciples!
If it were not for the great light of these four wisdom treasures of the TathÄgata touching them, it would be impossible for even one bodhisattva to attain the stage of the TathÄgata.
Buddha's disciples!
This is the fifth characteristic of the TathÄgata's mind. Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should know it in this way.
Furthermore, O Buddha-Son!

From the water level up to the heaven of neither perception nor non-perception, all the great trichiliocosm, the realms of desire, form, and formlessness, and the abodes of sentient beings, are all based on space to arise and abide in space.
Why is it so?
Because space is all-pervading;
although space universally accommodates the three realms, it is without discrimination.
O Buddha-Son!

The wisdom of the TathÄgata is also like this. Whether it is the wisdom of Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, the wisdom of conditioned activities, or the wisdom of unconditioned activities, all are based on the TathÄgata's wisdom to arise and abide in the TathÄgata's wisdom.
Why is it so?
Because the TathÄgata's wisdom pervades everywhere;
although it universally accommodates immeasurable wisdom, it is without discrimination.
O Buddha-Son!
This is the sixth characteristic of the TathÄgata's mind. Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should know it in this way.
Furthermore, O Buddha-Son!
On the summit of the snow mountains, there is a medicinal king tree,
called the 'inexhaustible root.'
The roots of that medicinal tree grow from a depth of 168,000 yojanas down to the water wheel of the adamantine ground.
When that medicinal king tree grows roots, it causes all the tree roots in JambudvÄ«pa to grow;
when it grows a trunk, it causes all the tree trunks in JambudvÄ«pa to grow;
branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits are all like this.
The roots of this medicinal king tree can grow trunks, and the trunks can grow roots. The roots are inexhaustible, and it is called
the 'inexhaustible root.'
O Buddha-Son!
That medicinal king tree causes growth everywhere, but it cannot bring growth and benefit to two places, namely:
the deep pits of hell and the water wheel;
but it never abandons them from the beginning.
Buddha's disciples!

The great medicine king tree of the TathÄgata's wisdom is also like this. It uses the past to give rise to and accomplish all wisdom and good dharmas, universally covering all realms of sentient beings, and eliminating the suffering of all evil destinies with vast compassionate vows as its roots. It grows in the true wisdom lineage of all tathÄgatas, with unshakable skillful means as its trunk, the wisdom of the Dharma realm and all pÄramitÄs as its branches, meditative absorptions, liberations, and great samÄdhis as its leaves, dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s, eloquence, and factors of enlightenment as its flowers, and the unchanging ultimate buddhas' liberation as its fruit.
Buddha's disciples!
Why is the great medicine king tree of the TathÄgata's wisdom called:
The inexhaustible root?
Because it is ultimately without rest, and because it does not cut off the bodhisattva practices;
The bodhisattva practices are the nature of the TathÄgata, and the nature of the TathÄgata is the bodhisattva practices. For this reason, they are called
the inexhaustible roots.
Buddha's disciple!
The great medicine king tree of the TathÄgata's wisdom, when its roots grow, causes all bodhisattvas to give rise to the root of great compassion that does not abandon sentient beings;
when its trunk grows, it causes all bodhisattvas to increase the trunk of firm and profound mind of diligence;
when its branches grow, it causes all bodhisattvas to increase the branches of all perfections;
when its leaves grow, it causes all bodhisattvas to grow the leaves of pure precepts, ascetic practices, merit, few desires, and contentment;
when its flowers grow, it causes all bodhisattvas to be endowed with the flowers of adornment with the marks and characteristics of all good roots;
when its fruits grow, it causes all bodhisattvas to attain the fruits of the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas up to the acceptance of consecration by all Buddhas.
Buddha's disciple!
The great medicinal tree of the TathÄgata's wisdom can only not bring about growth and benefit in two places:

The two vehicles have fallen into the vast and deep pit of the unconditioned, and sentient beings with damaged wholesome roots and unsuitable vessels are drowning in the waters of great wrong views and craving;
Yet he has never abandoned them.
Buddha's disciple!
The TathÄgata's wisdom has no increase or decrease, because the faculties are well-established and arise without rest.
Buddha's disciple!
This is the seventh characteristic of the TathÄgata's mind. Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should know it in this way.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!

It is like when the conflagration at the end of the eon arises in the trichiliocosm, burning everything - grasses, trees, forests, up to the Iron Encircling Mountains and the Great Iron Encircling Mountains - all becoming ablaze without remainder.
Buddha's disciple!
Suppose someone were to take dry grass in their hand and throw it into that fire. What do you think, would it not be burned?
He replied:
No, it would not.
Buddha's disciples!
The grass that is thrown in may not be burned;
The wisdom of the TathÄgata distinguishes the three times, all sentient beings, all lands, all eons, and all dharmas, and there is nothing it does not know;
If it is said that it does not know, this is not possible.
Why is this?
Because wisdom is universally illuminating.
Buddha's disciples!
This is the eighth characteristic of the TathÄgata's mind. Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should know it in this way.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciples!
It is like when the wind disaster destroys the world, a great wind arises, called
Scattering and Destroying, which can destroy the worlds of the trichiliocosm, including the Iron Encircling Mountains, all turning into dust.
There is another great wind, called
Able to Block, which completely surrounds the trichiliocosm, blocking the wind of scattering and destruction, preventing it from reaching the worlds in other directions.
Buddha's disciples!
If this great wind that obstructs were not present, the worlds in the ten directions would all be destroyed.
The TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One is also like this. There is a great wisdom wind, called
Able to Extinguish, which is able to extinguish the afflictive habits of all great bodhisattvas;
There is a great wisdom wind, called
Skillfully Upholding, which skillfully upholds the bodhisattvas whose faculties are not yet mature, preventing the great wisdom wind from severing all their afflictive habits.
Buddha's disciples!
If there were no wisdom wind of skillful upholding by the TathÄgata, innumerable bodhisattvas would all fall into the stages of Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas;
Because of this wisdom, it enables the bodhisattvas to transcend the stages of the two vehicles and abide in the ultimate stage of the TathÄgata.
Buddha's disciples!
This is the ninth characteristic of the TathÄgata's mind. Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should know it in this way.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciples!
The wisdom of the TathÄgata reaches everywhere.
Why is it so?
Not a single sentient being does not possess the wisdom of the TathÄgata, but due to inverted and attached thoughts, they do not realize it;
If they were to abandon inverted thoughts, the wisdom of omniscience, natural wisdom, and unobstructed wisdom would then manifest.
Buddha's disciples!
It is like a great sÅ«tra, the size of the trichiliocosm, written with the events within the trichiliocosm, all of them completely recorded.
Namely:ğŸ”½Writing the events within the great iron mountain, the size equal to the great iron mountain;
Writing the events within the great earth, the size equal to the great earth;ğŸ”½Writing the events within the middle chiliocosm, the size equal to the middle chiliocosm;
Writing the events within the small chiliocosm, the size equal to the small chiliocosm;

In the same way, whether it is the four continents, the great ocean, Mount Sumeru, the palaces of the gods on earth, the palaces of the gods dwelling in the sky in the desire realm, the palaces in the form realm, or the palaces in the formless realm, each is written down with the same size.
Although this great sÅ«tra is the same in size as the universe in the trichiliocosm, it still completely resides within a single atom;
just as with one atom, all atoms are also like this.

At that time, there was a person of wisdom and discernment, endowed with pure divine eyes, who saw this sÅ«tra within the atom, bringing little benefit to sentient beings, and immediately had this thought:
'I should use the power of diligence to break through that atom, bring out this sÅ«tra, and enable it to bring benefit to all sentient beings.'
Having had this thought, he immediately arose with skillful means, broke through that atom, brought out this great sÅ«tra, and enabled all sentient beings to universally obtain benefit.
Just as it is with a single dust mote, so it is with all dust motes.
Buddha's disciples!
The wisdom of the TathÄgata is also like this, immeasurable and unobstructed, universally able to benefit all sentient beings, complete and present within the bodies of sentient beings;
But ordinary foolish people are deluded and attached, unaware and unconcerned, and do not obtain benefit.
At that time, the TathÄgata, with his unobstructed eye of pure wisdom, universally observed all sentient beings in the Dharma realm and said this:
'How strange!
How strange!
How is it that these sentient beings possess the wisdom of the TathÄgata, yet are deluded and confused, unaware and unseen?
I shall teach them the holy path, enabling them to forever part from delusion and attachment, and within their own bodies to see the vast wisdom of the TathÄgata, no different from the Buddha.'
He then taught those sentient beings to cultivate the holy path and part from delusion;
Apart from delusion, one realizes the immeasurable wisdom of the TathÄgata and benefits and brings peace to all sentient beings.
Buddha's disciples!
This is the tenth characteristic of the TathÄgata's mind. Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should understand it in this way.
Buddha's disciples!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should know the mind of the TathÄgata, the Worthy of Offerings, the Perfectly Enlightened One, through immeasurable, unobstructed, inconceivable, and vast characteristics such as these.
At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, wanting to restate this meaning, spoke in verse, saying:
If you want to know the mind of the buddhas, you should observe the wisdom of the buddhas.
The wisdom of the buddhas has no basis, like space, which has nothing to rely on.
The various joys of sentient beings and their various skillful means of wisdom
All rely on the wisdom of the buddhas, but the wisdom of the buddhas has no basis.
The liberation of Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas
All depend on the Dharma realm, the Dharma realm has no increase or decrease.
Buddha's wisdom is also like this, giving rise to all wisdom,
without increase or decrease, without birth or end.
Just as water flows underground, if you seek it you will find it everywhere,
without thought and without end, its power pervades the ten directions.
Buddha's wisdom is also like this, universally present in the minds of sentient beings,
if there are those who diligently practice, they will quickly attain the light of wisdom.
Just as a dragon has four jewels, giving rise to all treasures,
placing them in a hidden place, ordinary people cannot see them.
The Buddha's four wisdoms are also like this, giving rise to all wisdom,
other people cannot see them, only the great bodhisattvas can.
Just as the ocean has four treasures, able to absorb all water,
preventing the ocean from overflowing, and also without increase or decrease.
The TathÄgata's wisdom is also like this, extinguishing waves and removing attachment to dharmas,
Vast and boundless, able to give rise to Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.
From the lower regions up to the peak of existence, the desire, form, and formless realms,
All depend on space, yet space is non-discriminating.
The wisdom of the assembly of Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas,
All depend on the Buddha's wisdom, yet the Buddha's wisdom is non-discriminating.
In the snowy mountains there is a medicinal king called the inexhaustible root,
Able to give rise to all trees, roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits.
The Buddha's wisdom is also like this, born from the TathÄgata's lineage,
Having attained enlightenment, it further gives rise to the bodhisattva practices.
If a person takes dry grass and places it in the burning eon,
Even vajra will be completely burned, this is the principle of nothing left unburned.
The kalpas and lands of the three times, as well as the sentient beings within them,
The grass may not be burned, but the Buddha knows all.
There is a wind called destruction, which can destroy the great trichiliocosm;
If there is no separate wind to stop it, it will destroy immeasurable realms.
The great wisdom wind is also like this, extinguishing the delusions of bodhisattvas;
There is a separate skillful wind that causes them to abide in the stage of the TathÄgata.
There is a great scripture scroll, its size equal to the trichiliocosm,
Contained within a single particle, and all particles are the same.
There is an intelligent and wise person with clear and bright eyes,
Who breaks open the particle to reveal the scripture scroll, universally benefiting sentient beings.
The Buddha's wisdom is also like this, pervading the minds of all beings,
Entangled by false thoughts, they are unaware and do not know.
The Buddhas, with great compassion, cause them to eliminate false thoughts,
In this way, they appear and benefit the bodhisattvas.
